question: Which one of the following statements is correct?
option1: Only the Rajya Sabha and not the Lok Sabha can have nominated members
option2: There is a constitutional provision for nominating two members belonging to the Anglo-Indian community to the Rajya Sabha
option3: There is no constitutional bar for a nominated member to be appointed Union minister
option4: A nominated member can vote both in the Presidential
answer: There is no constitutional bar for a nominated member to be appointed Union minister
explanation: In Rajya Sabha, 12 members are nominated by the President from the persons who have special knowledge in art, science, literature and social service. In Lok Sabha, 2 members are nominated by the President from the Anglo-Indian community (Art 331). A nominated member can vote only in the Vice- Presidential elections.
